segment.source: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment
segment.target: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment

segment.source: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment
segment.target: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment

segment.source: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment
segment.target: Illustrated Features of an MBAM 2.5 Deployment

segment.source: This topic describes the individual features that make up a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 deployment for the following topologies:
segment.target: This topic describes the individual features that make up a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 deployment for the following topologies:

segment.source: MBAM Stand-alone
segment.target: MBAM Stand-alone

segment.source: System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: These features do not represent the recommended architecture for deploying MBAM.
segment.target: These features do not represent the recommended architecture for deploying MBAM.

segment.source: Use this information only as a guide to understand the individual features that make up an MBAM deployment.
segment.target: Use this information only as a guide to understand the individual features that make up an MBAM deployment.

segment.source: See High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5 for the recommended architecture for MBAM.
segment.target: See High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5 for the recommended architecture for MBAM.

segment.source: For a list of the supported versions of the software mentioned in this topic, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a list of the supported versions of the software mentioned in this topic, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: MBAM Stand-alone topology
segment.target: MBAM Stand-alone topology

segment.source: The following image and table explain the features in an MBAM Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: The following image and table explain the features in an MBAM Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: mbab25
segment.target: mbab25

segment.source: Feature type Feature Description Database
segment.target: Feature type Feature Description Database

segment.source: Recovery Database
segment.target: Recovery Database

segment.source: This database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.
segment.target: This database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: This database stores compliance data, which is used primarily for the Reports that SQL Server Reporting Services hosts.
segment.target: This database stores compliance data, which is used primarily for the Reports that SQL Server Reporting Services hosts.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: Reporting Web Service
segment.target: Reporting Web Service

segment.source: This web service enables communication between the Administration and Monitoring Website and the SQL Server instance where reporting data is stored.
segment.target: This web service enables communication between the Administration and Monitoring Website and the SQL Server instance where reporting data is stored.

segment.source: This feature is installed on a server running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is installed on a server running Windows Server.

segment.source: Reporting Website (Administration and Monitoring Website)
segment.target: Reporting Website (Administration and Monitoring Website)

segment.source: You view Reports from the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: You view Reports from the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: The Reports provide recovery audit and compliance status data about the client computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: The Reports provide recovery audit and compliance status data about the client computers in your enterprise.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server.

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)

segment.source: Reports are configured in an SSRS database instance.
segment.target: Reports are configured in an SSRS database instance.

segment.source: Reports can be viewed directly from SSRS or from the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Reports can be viewed directly from SSRS or from the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance that is running SSRS.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance that is running SSRS.

segment.source: Self-Service Server
segment.target: Self-Service Server

segment.source: Self-Service Web Service
segment.target: Self-Service Web Service

segment.source: This web service is used by the MBAM Client and the Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal to communicate to the Recovery Database.
segment.target: This web service is used by the MBAM Client and the Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal to communicate to the Recovery Database.

segment.source: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Self-Service Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1, in which the MBAM Client, the Administration and Monitoring Website, and the Self-Service Portal communicate directly with the Recovery Database.
segment.target: The Self-Service Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1, in which the MBAM Client, the Administration and Monitoring Website, and the Self-Service Portal communicate directly with the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Self-Service Website (Self-Service Portal)
segment.target: Self-Service Website (Self-Service Portal)

segment.source: This website enables end users on client computers to independently sign in to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.
segment.target: This website enables end users on client computers to independently sign in to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Web Service
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Web Service

segment.source: The Monitoring Web Service is used by the MBAM Client and the websites to communicate to the databases.
segment.target: The Monitoring Web Service is used by the MBAM Client and the websites to communicate to the databases.

segment.source: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.
segment.target: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as the Help Desk
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as the Help Desk

segment.source: This Website is used by Help Desk users (users with the MBAM Report Users rights) to help end users regain access to their computers when they forget their PIN or password.
segment.target: This Website is used by Help Desk users (users with the MBAM Report Users rights) to help end users regain access to their computers when they forget their PIN or password.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology

segment.target: The following image and table explain the features in the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.target: Feature type Feature Description Self-Service Server

segment.target: Self-Service Web Service

segment.source: This web service is used by the MBAM Client and the Self-Service Portal to communicate to the Recovery Database.
segment.target: This web service is used by the MBAM Client and the Self-Service Portal to communicate to the Recovery Database.

segment.source: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is installed on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Self-Service Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1, in which the MBAM Client, the Administration and Monitoring Website, and the Self-Service Portal communicate directly with the Recovery Database.
segment.target: The Self-Service Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1, in which the MBAM Client, the Administration and Monitoring Website, and the Self-Service Portal communicate directly with the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Self-Service Website
segment.target: Self-Service Website

segment.source: This website enables end users on client computers to independently sign in to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.
segment.target: This website enables end users on client computers to independently sign in to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server/Recovery Audit Report
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server/Recovery Audit Report

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Web Service
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Web Service

segment.source: This web service enables communication between the Administration and Monitoring Website and the SQL Server databases where reporting data is stored.
segment.target: This web service enables communication between the Administration and Monitoring Website and the SQL Server databases where reporting data is stored.

segment.source: This feature is installed on a server running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is installed on a server running Windows Server.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.
segment.target: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: The Recovery Audit report is viewed from the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: The Recovery Audit report is viewed from the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Use the Configuration Manager console to view all other reports, or view reports directly from SQL Server Reporting Services.
segment.target: Use the Configuration Manager console to view all other reports, or view reports directly from SQL Server Reporting Services.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server.

segment.source: Databases
segment.target: Databases

segment.source: Recovery Database
segment.target: Recovery Database

segment.source: This database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.
segment.target: This database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Audit Database
segment.target: Audit Database

segment.source: This database stores audit information about recovery attempts and activity.
segment.target: This database stores audit information about recovery attempts and activity.

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and a supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Configuration Manager Features
segment.target: Configuration Manager Features

segment.source: Configuration Manager Management console
segment.target: Configuration Manager Management console

segment.source: This console is built into Configuration Manager and is used to view reports.
segment.target: This console is built into Configuration Manager and is used to view reports.

segment.source: For viewing reports only, this feature can be installed on any server or client computer.
segment.target: For viewing reports only, this feature can be installed on any server or client computer.

segment.source: Configuration Manager Reports
segment.target: Configuration Manager Reports

segment.source: Reports show compliance and recovery audit data for client computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: Reports show compliance and recovery audit data for client computers in your enterprise.

segment.source: The Reports feature is installed on a server running Windows Server and SSRS, and Reports run on a supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: The Reports feature is installed on a server running Windows Server and SSRS, and Reports run on a supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: A reporting services point must be defined in Configuration Manager on the server that is running SSRS.
segment.target: A reporting services point must be defined in Configuration Manager on the server that is running SSRS.

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services

segment.source: SSRS enables the MBAM Reports.
segment.target: SSRS enables the MBAM Reports.

segment.source: Reports can be viewed directly from SSRS or from the Configuration Manager console.
segment.target: Reports can be viewed directly from SSRS or from the Configuration Manager console.

segment.source: SSRS is installed on a server running Windows Server.
segment.target: SSRS is installed on a server running Windows Server.

segment.source: A reporting services point must be defined in Configuration Manager on the server that is running SSRS.
segment.target: A reporting services point must be defined in Configuration Manager on the server that is running SSRS.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
